name: Introduction to Creative Writing
description: This course provides a broad overview of the principles and conventions of creative writing, from fiction, nonfiction, and poetry to playwriting and screenwriting. Students are introduced to techniques for effective writing, the elements of style, and the fundamentals of narrative structure.

name: Creative Nonfiction Writing
description: In this course, students explore the practice of writing creative nonfiction. Students will analyze the techniques used in successful works of creative nonfiction and develop their own skills in this genre. Students will also learn the principles of research and methods for presenting their information in a clear and engaging way.

name: Advanced Creative Nonfiction Writing
description: This course builds on the fundamentals of creative nonfiction writing, teaching students how to write a compelling narrative with a clear structure. Students will explore more advanced techniques for writing creative nonfiction, including how to convey complex ideas and emotions, and how to create vivid and engaging characters. Students will also learn how to develop their own unique voice in their writing.
